title: Unable To Load Into Game (Adobe Flash/Hardware Acceleration Issue)
body:
Alright so for about a week now I've been unable to play and I'm fairly positive I know what the problem is, I just need to know how to fix it. The problem comes from Adobe flash and the hardware acceleration feature and I need to know how to turn that off somehow. About a week ago I noticed whenever I would try to put a youtube/twitch/etc. video into full screen, or load into a game of league (everything else in the client works fine) it would crash my system and give me the black screen of death. Now, I have fixed the issue with youtube and I did that by disabling hardware acceleration via chrome settings, however the problem is still there with league, obviously.

Does anyone know how to fix this? Any ideas are welcomed.

replies.body: Flash doesn't have any impact on the game itself, and wouldn't be causing this issue.  Unless you're getting a specific error when you say crash, the black screen problem is usually a network failure that can't download any assets for the match.  In this case, you should go over the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure your network is able to reach the game server without issue.  Let me know if you have any questions!

I managed to fix it! For now atleast. I did a few different things so im not sure exactly what did the trick. I turned off that game bar thing, I uninstalled a few windows updates, and I also messed around with adobe flash.

Thank you for your help though! I appreciate it.
